00004 assembly* load_pdb(char* file_name)
00005 {
00006   char* temp;
00007   WARN=1;SILENT=1;INWC=0;DATE=0;UNCUT=1;UNx=1;UNy=1;UNz=1;
00008   temp = suf; strcpy(temp,".pdb");
00009   temp = sufc; strcpy(temp,"_change.txt"); ACT='0';
00010   DEBUG=-1;LASTRES=-1;LASTOKX=0;LASTOKY=0;LASTOKZ=0;
00011   UNCTOL=0;CRYX=0;CRYY=0;CRYZ=0;LASTX=0;LASTY=0;LASTZ=0;
00012   //int resNum;
00013   int ma;
00014   //molecule* mol;
00015   assembly* asmbl;
00016   IN = myfopen(file_name, "r");
00017  /*scans pdb file for number of lines
00018   allocates memory for line structures
00019   initializes structures that contain line formats*/
00020   init_struct();
00021   rewind(IN);
00022   //Read in lines to ln structure
00023   printf("Reading in %s...\n",file_name);
00024   for(ma=0;ma<INWC;ma++){
00025   if(DEBUG>=1){printf("made it to here main line loop %d ...\n", ma);} 
00026         rwm_line(ma+1);
00027         }
00028   //Determine the number of molecules in the pdb
00029   printf("There are %d molecule(s)\n",howManyMolecules());
00030   asmbl = getAssembly();
00031   printf("PDB Information Successfully Read.\n");
00032   free(ln);
00033   return asmbl;
00034 }

00036 molecule load_pdb_from_slurp(fileslurp in){
00037  int i,hldr;
00038  int minRes = -1;
00039  char* temp;
00040  init_struct_slurp(in);
00041  for(i = 0; i < in.n; i++){     //Assign data to the rwm line
00042   rwm_line_char(in.L[i],i+1);
00043   if(isAtom((ln+i))){           //And determine the smallest residue
00044    temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&hldr);
00045    if(minRes > hldr || minRes < 0){minRes = hldr;}
00046   }
00047  }
00048  INWC = in.n;
00049  return (*getMolecule(minRes));
00050 }

00052 fileslurp isolateInputPDB(fileslurp S){
00053  int i,itr;
00054  char* plc;
00055  fileslurp O; O.n = 0; itr = 0;
00056  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00057   if(strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: ATOM")!=NULL ||         //These cover the two types of
00058      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: HETATM")!=NULL ||       //AD3 style input data
00059      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: ATOM")!=NULL || //These cover the two types of
00060      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: HETATM")!=NULL) //AD4 style input data
00061    O.n++;
00062  }
00063  O.L = (char**)calloc(O.n,sizeof(char*));
00064  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00065   if(strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: ATOM")!=NULL ||
00066      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: HETATM")!=NULL ||
00067      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: ATOM")!=NULL ||
00068      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: HETATM")!=NULL){
00069    if(strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: ")!=NULL)
00070     plc = S.L[i]+12;    //Based on what starts the line, duplicate the line minus
00071    else                 //The first couple of words
00072     plc = S.L[i]+20;
00073    O.L[itr] = strdup(plc); itr++;
00074   }
00075  }
00076  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++)
00077   free(S.L[i]);
00078  free(S.L);
00079  return O;
00080 }

00082 fileslurp isolateDockedPDB(fileslurp S){
00083  int i,itr;
00084  char* plc;
00085  fileslurp O; O.n = 0; itr = 0;
00086  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00087   if(strstr(S.L[i],"DOCKED: ATOM")!=NULL)
00088    O.n++;
00089  }
00090  O.L = (char**)calloc(O.n,sizeof(char*));
00091  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00092   if(strstr(S.L[i],"DOCKED: ATOM")!=NULL){
00093    plc = S.L[i]+8;
00094    O.L[itr] = strdup(plc); itr++;
00095   }
00096  }
00097  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++)
00098   free(S.L[i]);
00099  free(S.L);
00100  return O;
00101 }

00104 int howManyMolecules()
00105 {
00106  int i; int counter = 0;
00107 
00108  for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00109   if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)//If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00110    counter++;
00111  if(counter == 0 || isAtom(ln+(INWC-1)) == 1)
00112   counter ++;
00113  return counter;
00114 }

00116 assembly* getAssembly()
00117 {
00118   int molNum = howManyMolecules();
00119   int i = 0;int j = 0;int k = 0;int l = 0;int atom_num;double x,y,z;
00120   char* temp;char name[6] = ""; char* atmName = name;
00121   assembly* asmbl = (assembly*) malloc (1 * sizeof(assembly));
00122   (*asmbl).nm = molNum;
00123   molecule* mol = (molecule*) malloc (molNum * sizeof(molecule));
00124   (*asmbl).m = (molecule**)calloc(1,sizeof(molecule*));//added by MNT on 20080806
00125   (*asmbl).m[0] = mol; // changed by BLF on 20080622 -- might need revisiting
00126   molecule* curMol; residue* curRes;// residue* res;
00127   atom* curAtm;// atom* atm;
00128   //Get all the information for the first molecule
00129   curMol = (mol+j);
00130   (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i,0);
00131   (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00132   getResInfo((*curMol).r,i,1);
00133   curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00134   (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00135   curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00136   for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00137   {
00138     //If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00139     if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)
00140     {
00141       j++;
00142       curMol = (mol+j);
00143       (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i+1,0);
00144       (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00145       getResInfo((*curMol).r,i+1,1);
00146       curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00147       k = 0;l = 0;
00148       (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00149       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00150     }
00151     else if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00152     {
00153       if(l == (*curRes).na)
00154       {
00155        k++;l = 0;
00156        curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00157        (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom)); 
00158        //curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00159       }
00160       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00161       //Getting the atom #
00162       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[1].c;
00163       sscanf(temp,"%d",&atom_num);
00164       //Getting the atom name
00165       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[3].c;
00166       sscanf(temp,"%s",atmName);
00167       //Getting the X coordinate
00168       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[11].c;
00169       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&x);
00170       //Getting the Y coordinate
00171       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[12].c;
00172       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&y);
00173       //Getting the Z coordinate
00174       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[13].c;
00175       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&z);   
00176 
00177       (*curAtm).n = atom_num;//set the atom #
00178       (*curAtm).N = strdup(atmName);//set the atom name
00179       //set the atom's coordinates
00180       (*curAtm).x.i = x; (*curAtm).x.j = y; (*curAtm).x.k = z;
00181       l++;
00182     }
00183   }
00184  return asmbl;
00185 }

00187 int findTotalResidue(int start,int minRes)
00188 {
00189   int ret=0,hRes=0;int i = start;int thisRes;//int curRes = 0;
00190   char* temp;
00191   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC)
00192   {
00193     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00194     {
00195       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00196       sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00197       //The New Way
00198       if(hRes < thisRes)
00199        hRes = thisRes;       
00200       //THE OLD WAY
00201 /*      if(thisRes != curRes)
00202       { 
00203         ret ++;
00204         curRes = thisRes;
00205       }*/
00206     }
00207    i++;
00208   }
00209   //More of the New Way
00210   if(minRes < 1){ret = hRes;}
00211   else{ret = hRes - (minRes-1);}
00212   return ret;
00213 }

00215 int endOfMol(linedef* line)
00216 {
00217   if(((*line).a == 4 && (*line).b == 2)||
00218      ((*line).a == 2 && ((*line).b == 9||(*line).b == 3)))
00219     return 1;
00220   else
00221     return 0;
00222 }
00223 
00224 int isAtom(linedef* line)
00225 {
00226   if(((*line).a == 2 || (*line).a == 3) && (*line).b == 1)
00227     return 1;
00228   else
00229     return 0;
00230 }
00231 void getResInfo(residue* res, int start, int minRes)
00232 {
00233   int thisRes,hldr;int i = start;
00234   int resNum=-1;
00235   residue* curRes;
00236   char name [10];char* temp;char* resName = name;
00237   while(isAtom(ln+i) == 0 && i < INWC)
00238    i++;
00239   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC){
00240    if(isAtom(ln+i) == 1){
00241     temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&hldr);
00242     if(resNum != hldr){ //If this is a different residue than the one in the previous line
00243      resNum = hldr;     //Set resNum as the actual residue number
00244      thisRes=hldr-minRes;//Set thisRes as the index of the residue
00245      curRes = (res+thisRes);
00246      temp = (*(ln+i)).f[5].c; sscanf(temp,"%s",resName);
00247     }
00248     //If this residue has not been found yet
00249     if((*curRes).N == 0X0 || strcmp(resName,(*curRes).N) != 0){
00250      (*curRes).N = strdup(resName);     //Set the residue name
00251      (*curRes).n = resNum;              //Set the actual residue number
00252      (*curRes).na = 0;                  //...and make sure the total # of atoms is 0
00253     }//Otherwise we can assume all of these have already been set
00254     (*curRes).na++;
00255    }//End if an atom
00256     //..and then incriment to the next line
00257     i++;
00258   }//End loop through file
00259  return ;
00260 }

00262 molecule* getMolecule(int minRes){
00263   int molNum = 1;
00264   int i = 0,rI = -1;//int j = 0;int k = 0;
00265   int ntX;
00266   //double x,y,z;
00267   double dblY;
00268   char* temp;char name[6] = ""; //char* atmName = name;
00269   molecule* mol = (molecule*)calloc(molNum,sizeof(molecule));
00270   residue* curRes;// residue* res;
00271   atom* curAtm;// atom* atm;
00272   //Get all the information for the first molecule
00273   (*mol).nr = findTotalResidue(i,minRes);
00274   (*mol).r = (residue*)calloc((*mol).nr,sizeof(residue));
00275   getResInfo((*mol).r,i,minRes);
00276   int l[(*mol).nr];
00277   for(i = 0; i < (*mol).nr; i++){
00278    (*mol).r[i].a = (atom*)calloc((*mol).r[i].na,sizeof(atom));
00279    l[i] = 0;
00280   }
00281   //resIdx = -1;
00282   for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00283   {
00284     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00285     {
00286       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&ntX);
00287       if(rI != ntX - minRes)
00288       {
00289        rI = ntX -minRes;
00290        curRes = ((*mol).r+rI);
00291       }
00292       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l[rI]);
00293       //Getting the record name
00294       temp = (*(ln+i)).f[0].c; sscanf(temp,"%s",name);
00295       (*curAtm).D = strdup(name);
00296       //Getting the atom #
00297       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[1].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&ntX);
00298       (*curAtm).n = ntX;
00299       //Getting the atom name
00300       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[3].c; sscanf(temp,"%s",name);
00301       (*curAtm).N = strdup(name);
00302       //Getting the chain identifier
00303       (*curAtm).cID = (*(ln+i)).f[7].c[0];
00304 
00305       //Getting the X coordinate
00306       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[11].c; sscanf(temp,"%lf",&dblY); (*curAtm).x.i = dblY;
00307       //Getting the Y coordinate
00308       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[12].c; sscanf(temp,"%lf",&dblY); (*curAtm).x.j = dblY;
00309       //Getting the Z coordinate
00310       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[13].c; sscanf(temp,"%lf",&dblY); (*curAtm).x.k = dblY;   
00311 
00312       l[rI]++;
00313     }
00314   }
00315  return mol;
00316 }
